description: Mortuary structure on a chalk knoll, activity beginning in the Middle Iron Age, in the Late Iron Age it is enclosed and identified as a 'shrine'. Burials continue until the 2nd CE, but use of the structure may have begun again in the Late Roman period and continued into the 5th CE.
bibliography: “Life and Afterlife at Duxford, Cambridgeshire: Archaeology and History in a Chalkland Community.” East Anglian Archaeology 141 (2011). https://eaareports.org.uk/publication/report141/.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Duxford (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
